page.title: 01Mr Collier's Truck Works
page.content: Mr Collier's business started on Valentine's Day 1959 making garden furniture.Now he employs 50 people and is the largest employer in our block. There are 3 women and 47 men averaging 35 years of age, working 40 hours basic week,and up to 52 hours with overtime. The factory is unique because it builds many types of bodies including: Box Vans Platform Trucks Luton Vans Drop Sides Drey Bodies Mobile Shops Refridgerated Crane Loaders. To make the bodies he uses alloy, Timber, Plywood, Fibreglass, Steel and Polystyrene. It takes from 40 hours to 5 weeks to build a body, about 600 a year. The bodies are made in a factory covering 36,000 sq ft. A new paintshop will cost 300,000 pounds and contains two large ovens and three work bays.
